reviewText: An under achiever (stereotypical blond) played by Reese Witherspoon is dumped by her boyfriend that prefers to marry someone sophisticated and intelligent to further his career. The challenge is to retrieve her lost love at any cost; even if it means having to go law school.It goes down hill from there as the movie is formal and filled with clichés. There are some interesting side stories but not enough to save from the mediocre main plot. The outcome is not surprising but satisfying.

reviewText: The 2 movies have individual CDs something that I appreciate. The two movies are very funny and  Reese Witherspoon gave a magnificent performance in both movies. In general there is very good acting in both movies, Legally Blonde#1 being the best of the two.

reviewText: Reese Witherspoon excels at playing Ellie, a blond, fashion-conscious young woman who goes from being a spoiled rich girl intent on marrying a rich guy to a lawyer willing to take on the big guys. Both movies deliver important messages with plenty of humor. I definitely prefer the first movie over the sequel, but both are worth watching.

reviewText: These two movies are so lame and there wasn't much else in the theaters when they came out which helped the box office success.  These are tacky stories and not going to encourage anyone to knuckle down and do what needs to get done to get into a good school.  Also, show your daughter Penelope which Reese Witherspoon produced.
summary: GROSS - see Reese Witherspoon in Freeway instead

reviewText: Reese Witherspoon is phenomenal in this role.  She's a stupendous talent!  I love the first and like the second film.  Fans of The Vampire Diaries will recognize her Beau who plays Mason in the TVD series.  Basically it's the ludicrous story of a "blonde" (in every sense of the word) who looks to prove to her boyfriend who jilted her that she's more than a pretty face surrounded by golden tresses by going to Harvard too.  Along the way she proves much more and to herself too.  Part two is very good but not as good as the first.  Definitely recommend them to all Witherspoon fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Legally Blonde 2 had some funny moments, but it's just gets a bit too silly at times. Congressmen doing "snaps" and crying during committee hearings? Cheerleaders on the capitol steps? I know this is a comedy, but at times it almost seems too goofy to watch. It'll probably appeal more to kids and young teen girls than wider audiences.
summary: Not quite as good as the original
Title: N/A

reviewText: Reese has done so many things, but Playing Elle woods was masterful. The upbeat looks, the great expressions, the great Timing. Wonderful writing, great delivery and masterful performance. The cast in both movies are nothing short of brilliant.  Reese Witherspoon is America's sweetheart and these movies will show you why and will show you how great an actress she truly is. An American Icon not only in Reese but in Elle Woods as well. Whenever I feel down I pop in the dvd or watch the instant video of Elle woods and Legally Blond and Reese always cheers me up. A must see pair of Movies for everyone. Fun Family movie as well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love the "Legally Blonde" series itself and the 'Elle-ify Your Life' accessories make the movie even BETTER!!! I suggest that any "Legally Blonde" 1&2 movie-lover buy this special PLATINUM edition. It comes in a cute package and it's cheap for 2 DVDs, a small pink notepad, a fabulous pink pen, and lovely fun word magnets.It's rare to find these in stores so GET IT AT AMAZON!! :) It's the perfect gift for yourself or for anybody else who is a [big] fan of Reese Witherspoon and/or "Legally Blonde"!!!!

reviewText: I didn't think this movie would be my thing, but someone told me years ago that it was funny. I was surprised that it was not the typical "young adult" movie. Some parts might not be appropriate for young views (mostly just some of the language), but all-in-all, both movies are very wholesome and I thought pretty clever in their plots. The actress does a great job and I wish she had done more of these. They were not your typical "romantic" comedies: very little romance involved. They are good movies when you want to watch something light-hearted and not depressing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I first saw this movie with my teenage son, I admit that my expectations were not particularly high. Was I ever pleasantly surprised by this delightfully funny comedy! Reese Witherspoon does a star turn as the not so dumb, California airhead blonde, Ellie Woods, who is dumped by her college sweetheart, Warner, before graduation, instead of getting the anticipated and expected marriage proposal. It appears that he has political aspirations and an ostensibly dumb and flamboyant blonde is not what he envisions having for a wife.Seeking to prove herself worthy and knowing that he is planning on attending Harvard Law School, Ellie, a fashion major, also seeks admission with dogged determination and studies her charming buns off in order to do well on the LSAT, the Law School Admission Test. Her high LSAT scores, coupled with her hilarious admission video, and her perfect college grade point average, albeit in Fashion, get her through the portals of Harvard Law School, and the games begin in earnest.What happens to her at Harvard is hilarious, as Ellie tries to get her former sweetheart back. She discovers, instead, something about herself that ultimately makes others sit up and take notice of her in a positive way. Reese Witherspoon is delightfully funny doing a comic turn and will have the viewer laughing almost immediately, while rooting for her. The supporting cast is likewise enjoyable. This is a funny, wacky comedy that is never mean spirited and is, instead, surprisingly uplifting.

reviewText: The star rating for this product is a cumulative grade for both films put together. Legally Blonde by itself is worthy of four stars because it was a very good flick, but the sequel left a lot to be desired and only garnered two stars by itself.The first film was a solid, with a few jokes about Californian blondes, but Reese Witherspoon's character is solid and likeable, and the plot itself is also enjoyable if a bit light-hearted, but serious enough to deliver a solid film that stands on its own merit.I cannot say the same about the sequel. I have nothing against homosexuality and infact strongly support gay rights, but the way it was presented in this film with the two gay dogs - and 'skorts' - was a huge blow to the film's credibility. This installment of Legally Blonde just failed to find the right balance between seriousness and light-heartedness. If you liked Legally Blonde, you might like the sequel, and it did have some funny parts, but it simply fails to deliver the same results as the first one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Reese Whitherspoon. You either like her or don't.  Both are very cute movies and typical of the "Goldie Hawn/Kate Hudson" type of film.  These are star vehicles and enjoyable as long as you don't take them too seriously.What I didn't like was the cheap re-packaging by Fox into a 2-disc set.  The new style box with more holes than plastic in it.  For that reason (or sloppy handling) disc #2 had some odd surface or handling scratches. Shrink-wrap doesn't always mean factory fresh.Content:  Disc #1 (Legaly Blonde) was a bare-bones copy with no features, unless you consider wide/full option a feature. Not even a music video on this one.  The original DVD release had this plus outtakes and trailer.Disc #2 (L.B. #2) A full-featured disc with the typical out-takes, music video, and trailers.Due to the funny hash-marks/scratches on the 2nd disc, I would have returned it if it was bought locally.  The disc didn't look brand new but it played o.k.Amazon warehoused-merchandise is usually received in better shape than this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 'Legally Blonde' movies are fun, lively, vibrant, and empowering without being overbearing.  I would discuss plot points as that has been done to death but I will say that this set is well worth getting if one simply wishes to have both films to enjoy whenever they wish.
